page.title: 05THE CHINA CLAY INDUSTRY PT4
page.content: The mining of China Clay leaves {large scars}on the{environment.}As an open-cast operation it is visible for all to see. There is a vast amount of waste. For every tonne of kaolin, there are 6 tonnes of quartz sand, 1 tonne of overburden and 1 tonne of mica. Years ago at the turn of the century, men cared little about the effect of the waste on the environment, and waste material was dumped on tips that became conical in shape.Slowly vegetation such as heather,ling and gorse became established; old pits filled with water and were dangers to the local population. Today, tips are built differently. The law demands that overburden should be separated from other waste and sand is dumped in stable platforms, forming flat-topped hills.
